title: KFC bringing back £5.99 hot wings bucket - but you'll have to be quick to get it
text:
Get the biggest Money Deals stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

If you love a piece of fried chicken, you might be pleased to hear that the KFC hot wings bucket deal is back.

Customers can currently save £4 on a 20-piece bucket of hot wings.

The super saving sees customers able to buy the spicy feast for £5.99 - instead of the usual price of £9.99.

But you'll have to be quick if you want to get your hands on the bargain bucket, as the offer is only available until November 17.

(Image: Getty Images)

The deal is running across all KFC restaurants in the UK.

And getting your hands on one couldn't be easier.

All you have to do is download the KFC app and log on to get a voucher code, which you show at the till when making your purchase.

The app is free to install on your phone and can be downloaded from the Apple Store or Google Play.

Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now

Two hot wings typically cost 99p a pair at the chicken chain and contain 85 calories each.

The bucket isn't the only deal KFC is currently offering customers.

Right now you can get two fillet burgers for £6 - which is a saving of £1.98.

The company's popular 12-piece boneless dipping feast is usually priced at £18.99 but is also on offer for £16 and includes 12 mini fillets, chips, sweetcorn and popcorn chicken, and is served with the original dips bar.
description: Calling all KFC lovers, the fast food chain is bringing back their £5.99 hot wings bucket deal
